summary: The prophet Zachariah predicts the future destruction of Jerusalem by the Romans, describing it as vengeance for the crucifixion of Christ. He foretells the destruction of the city, its temple, and its people. Despite the impending destruction, Zachariah also prophesies the Lord's gentle visitation of the city, announcing the arrival of a righteous and savior king, riding on a donkey, as fulfillment of messianic expectations.
